name: Chip Brogden
description:
Chip Brogden ( - )
Listen to freely downloadable audio sermons by the speaker Chip Brogden in mp3 format.  Author, teacher, and former pastor, Chip and his wife Karla came out of the church in 1999 to serve those who are following Jesus outside of Organized Religion. Today, The School of Christ reaches many with a simple, consistent, and Christ-centered message
Since 1997, the School of Christ has reached more than 145 nations with a simple, consistent, and Christ-centered message. Our mission is to bring healing to those hurt by religion, to provide for the spiritual growth and maturity of all believers, and to ensure the continuity of a Christ-Centered Faith.

audio_sermons.title: The Strength Of Seeing
audio_sermons.description: "The very least in the Kingdom of God is born into victory...You see, victory today has nothing to do with me; it has nothing to do with how I feel; it has nothing to do with what I'm going through; it has everything to do with Who lives on the inside of me! Christ is my victory!" This message was delivered in March, 2003 at Ocean Isle Beach Chapel, North Carolina.
audio_sermons.preacher_description:
Chip Brogden ( - )
Listen to freely downloadable audio sermons by the speaker Chip Brogden in mp3 format. audio_sermons.title: Vanity, Or Spirit And Truth?
audio_sermons.description: "And she stood before the congregation, and spat on the floor, and said, 'That is what God thinks of your worship!' "Jesus says, 'You hypocrites! You draw near to Me with your mouth, and you honor Me with your lips, but your hearts are far from Me.' May God turn our hearts back to Him..." This message was delivered in April, 2003 at Ocean Isle Beach Chapel, North Carolina.
audio_sermons.preacher_description:
Chip Brogden ( - )

audio_sermons.title: Why Is The Spirit Given
audio_sermons.description: There are only two kinds of knowledge in the universe: flesh and blood, or Spirit and Truth. It is only when the Spirit of God reveals Christ to us that we can truly know Him as He is. Learning how to cooperate with the Holy Spirit is critical to our continued growth in grace and knowledge of Christ. The Spirit reveals Christ, leads us deeper into Him, and prepares us to enter the Kingdom of God. This excerpt was recorded live during our day-long School of Christ workshop on March 12, 2005, in Wilson, N.C.
